poem:
**Victory Plan**

Against the morning gray
a handshake, firm and whispered—
banners rustling silent secrets.
At the heart of corridors,
worlds converge—
threads of aid and hope intertwine,
whispering victories.

Beside the flags,
time's breath—
skerzando through trembling leaves.
In silence they conspire,
an embrace of promise—
beyond the horizon,
peace beckons.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zelenskyy meets Biden to pitch ‘victory plan’ to end war with Russia Joe Biden and Volodymyr Zelenskyy have met at the White House where the Ukrainian leader is expected to present a high-stakes “victory plan” to end the war with Russia with additional American aid. Zelenskyy has kept the details of the plan secret, but US officials have said it includes additional American aid in the military, economic and political spheres to prevent a Ukrainian". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
